agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from a Goshen Health provider. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for full or partial financial assistance based on their income.
site_details: Patients MUST submit an application for financial assistance in order to be considered for assistance. Call the Patient Financial Services office or contact a financial counselor at any Goshen Health hospital to request a Financial Assistance Application. The Financial Assistance Application may also be submitted online.
site_eligibility: Received or receiving medically necessary health care services from an Goshen Health provider (or guarantor of someone who received such services) -- Low to moderate income (Those below 200% of Federal Poverty Level may be eligible for free care.)

agency_desc: Community mental health center serving Elkhart and St. Joseph counties.
service_description: Provides 24-hour phone crisis intervention for persons experiencing a mental health or addiction crisis. agency_desc: A nonprofit child and family advocacy agency with services throughout Indiana.
service_description: Offers statewide virtual training for persons interested in becoming licensed for foster care. Foster parents receive 24-hour staff support, counseling services, financial reimbursement, support groups, and respite care. Eligible candidates must be physically and emotionally able to handle challenges presented. Both single persons and married couples are welcome.
site_details: Visit website to complete online interest form, register for upcoming pre-service training dates, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 21 or older -- Able to pass a criminal history, child abuse, and sexual abuse registry check -- Able to meet state foster care licensing requirements

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides residential care, day treatment, alternative education, foster care, and many other services.
service_description: Provides emergency shelter for children ages 6-18 in crisis situations, including emergency hospitalization or short-term jail of a parent and youth who are running away from unsafe homes. Children may stay in the shelter as long as necessary while underlying causes of crisis are addressed.
site_details: Call to request emergency shelter; parental permission is not required to enter shelter.
site_eligibility: Youth -- Age 6-18 years old

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides residential care, day treatment, alternative education, foster care, and many other services.
service_description: Provides emergency shelter for children ages 6-18 in crisis situations, including emergency hospitalization or short-term jail of a parent and youth who are running away from unsafe homes. Children may stay in the shelter as long as necessary while underlying causes of crisis are addressed.
site_details: Call to request emergency shelter; parental permission is not required to enter shelter.
site_eligibility: Youth -- Age 6-18 years old

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides residential care, day treatment, alternative education, foster care, and many other services.
service_description: Offers one-day counseling classes for children (Seasons) and parents (Trans Parenting) who are dealing with divorce and paternity issues. Children's classes focus on age-appropriate coping skills; parent's classes focus on effective co-parenting during transition.
site_details: Call or visit the website to register.
site_eligibility: Families with children -- Age 18 or younger

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides residential care, day treatment, alternative education, foster care, and many other services.
service_description: Offers parenting classes for parents of children ages 6-18 years old. Topics include family development and dealing with crisis situations for challenging children. Attendance at each class is not required; classes can be attended in any order. Child care and meals are provided.
site_details: Call for information or to register for a class.
site_eligibility: Parents of children --  Age 6-18 years old

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_name: BUREAU OF CHILD DEVELOPMENT SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A government agency assuring Indiana families with infants and toddlers experiencing developmental delays or disabilities have access to early intervention services close to home when they need them through a coordinated system of local inter-agency councils called First Steps.
site_name: FIRST STEPS OF NORTHEAST INDIANA - CLUSTER B
service_description: Serves as an entry point for infants and toddlers who have or are at risk for developmental delays. Services include home-based special instruction; occupational, physical, and speech therapy; access to health and social services; and case management.
taxonomy_name: Early Intervention for Children With Disabilities/Delays
nameLevel3: Early Intervention for Children With Disabilities/Delays
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in DeKalb, Elkhart, Fulton, Kosciusko, LaGrange, Marshall, Noble, St. Joseph, Steuben or Whitley County -- Ages 0-3 -- With, or at risk for, developmental delays

agency_name: THE CENTER - FAMILY CHRISTIAN DEVELOPMENT CENTER
agency_desc: "Our mission is to demonstrate the love of Christ by bringing together the resources of our community in order to transform our community."
site_name: THE CENTER - FAMILY CHRISTIAN DEVELOPMENT CENTER
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance for rent and utilities to persons in need, living in the Wa-Nee School District,  when funds are available. agency_name: ADVOCACY LINKS RESOURCE AND ADVOCACY CENTER, INC.
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that assists with finding and obtaining various types of resources and identifying social engagement opportunities for individuals with varying levels of ability, age, and income.
site_name: ADVOCACY LINKS RESOURCE AND ADVOCACY CENTER
service_description: Offers referrals to social activities and events for all age groups in rural and urban counties. Activities may include visiting Indiana destinations, movies and theaters, fitness clubs, social clubs, gaming groups, sporting events, educational classes, and more.
site_details: Visit the website to see a list of available events and to register.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: ADVOCACY LINKS RESOURCE AND ADVOCACY CENTER, INC.
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that assists with finding and obtaining various types of resources and identifying social engagement opportunities for individuals with varying levels of ability, age, and income.
site_name: ADVOCACY LINKS RESOURCE AND ADVOCACY CENTER
service_description: Offers assistance finding and obtaining various resources such as adaptive devices and toys, specialist visits, in-home help services, transportation, information related to IEP and school services, special needs trust,  and new diagnoses, and more. The agency provides a Connection Specialist who assists with contacting agencies, completing applications, and more. The service is available for individuals with varying levels of ability, age, and income.
site_details: Call to discuss the resources needed. -- If there is no answer, leave a voicemail with your name and phone number.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Elkhart County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, go the prosecutor's office to get packet to open a case. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Mon 8am-noon and 1pm-5pm -- Tues-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours -- live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Elkhart County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Elkhart County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies; call details
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to crime victims in Elkhart County. Assists in the filing of restraining or protective orders, offers court accompaniment services, and provides information about case status, victim compensation, victim rights, and the legal process.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Victims of major crimes in Elkhart County

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
site_name: INDIANA STATE POLICE - DISTRICT 21 TOLL ROAD
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana. This district office serves Clark, Floyd, Harrison, Scott, and Washington County.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; this district office serves Elkhart, LaGrange, Lake, La Porte, Porter, St Joseph, and Steuben County.

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides adult basic education, skills training, and career services for Elkhart County.
service_description: Offers English language acquisition programs for English language learners who wish to learn to speak, write and understand English. This program is offered in partnership with Goshen College.
site_details: Call to enroll.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 9am-5pm; Tues and Wed 9am-6pm; Fri 9am-3pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides adult basic education, skills training, and career services for Elkhart County.
service_description: Offers computer-based instruction in basic reading, math, language arts, technology, life skills, and job readiness as well as preparation for the high school equivalency test. Participants work at their own pace from home or at a partnering location.
site_details: Call or walk in to pre-register for orientation.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 9am-5pm; Tues and Wed 9am-6pm; Fri 9am-3pm
site_eligibility: Age 16 or older -- Not enrolled in high school (documentation required for ages 16-17)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides adult basic education, skills training, and career services for Elkhart County.
service_description: Offers computer-based instruction in basic reading, math, language arts, technology, life skills, and job readiness as well as preparation for the high school equivalency test. Participants work at their own pace from home or at a partnering location.
site_details: Call or walk in to pre-register for orientation.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 9am-5pm; Tues and Wed 9am-6pm; Fri 9am-3pm
site_eligibility: Age 16 or older -- Not enrolled in high school (documentation required for ages 16-17)

agency_desc: REAL Services is the Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area 2), providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Elkhart, Koscousko, Marshall, Fulton, and St Joseph County. They are also the Community Action Agency for these counties.
service_description: Provides case management services for families striving to become self-sufficient. Topics include continuing education, vocational training, budgeting, and parenting skills. Services are tailored to meet each individual family's needs, and referrals to community resources are provided as needed. Limited financial assistance may be available to help complete education needs.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule initial appointment
site_eligibility: Age 18 and older -- At or below 125% of the Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides low-cost, nutritious meals and limited food vouchers for area seniors.
service_description: Offers Farmers Market vouchers to eligible seniors at no cost to use at participating farmers markets for fresh fruits and vegetables. Each participant receives $20 in vouchers, while supplies last.
site_details: Walk in to apply.
site_eligibility:
○Living in Elkhart, Kosciusko, Marshall, Fulton, or St Joseph County
○Age 60 or older
○Household income at or below 185% federal poverty guidelines

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides low-cost, nutritious meals and limited food vouchers for area seniors.
service_description: Provides a hot lunch each weekday to seniors age 60 or older. Reservations must be made by 11am the previous business day. A small donation is requested but not required.
site_details: Call to make a reservation by 11am the day before the meal.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older (and accompanying spouse of any age)

service_description: Provides a hot lunch each weekday to seniors age 60 or older. Reservations must be made by 11am the previous business day. A small donation is requested but not required.
site_details: Call to make a reservation by 11am the day before the meal.
site_eligibility: Age 60 and older (and accompanying spouse of any age)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides low-cost, nutritious meals and limited food vouchers for area seniors.
site_name: REAL SERVICES NUTRITION SITES - GOSHEN - GREENCROFT DRIVE
service_description: Provides a hot lunch each weekday to seniors age 60 or older. Reservations must be made by 11am the previous business day. A small donation is requested but not required.
site_details: Call to make a reservation by 11am the day before the meal.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older (and accompanying spouse of any age)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides low-cost, nutritious meals and limited food vouchers for area seniors.
site_name: REAL SERVICES NUTRITION SITES - GOSHEN - GREENCROFT DRIVE
service_description: Offers Farmers Market vouchers to eligible seniors at no cost to use at participating farmers markets for fresh fruits and vegetables. Each participant receives $20 in vouchers, while supplies last.
site_details: Call or walk in for information, or to apply.
site_eligibility:
○Living in Elkhart, Kosciusko, Marshall, Fulton, or St Joseph County
○Age 60 or older
○Household income at or below 185% federal poverty guidelines

agency_name: AIDS MINISTRIES - AIDS ASSIST OF NORTHERN INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides education and support services to persons diagnosed with HIV and AIDS.
service_description: Offers free, anonymous HIV testing, open to all.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 15 or older

agency_name: AIDS MINISTRIES - AIDS ASSIST OF NORTHERN INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides education and support services to persons diagnosed with HIV and AIDS.
service_description: Provides prevention education and awareness, open to all, about the transmission of HIV and AIDS. Testing is available on-site. Referrals for counseling and other support services are provided for at-risk clients or persons dealing with HIV and AIDS. Free condoms are available by request.
site_details: Call for further information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: AIDS MINISTRIES - AIDS ASSIST OF NORTHERN INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides education and support services to persons diagnosed with HIV and AIDS.
service_description: Provides mental and physical health care referrals and care coordination free of charge for HIV positive individuals. Assists clients in locating additional services such as food, housing, transportation, employment, legal, health insurance, and financial assistance.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Elkhart, Fulton, Kosciusko, Marshall, Pulaski, St Joseph, or Starke County -- Diagnosed with HIV -- Age 18 or older -OR- ages 12-18 with parent permission

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides a variety of social services, including employment related services and educational services.
service_description: Offers adults the chance to earn an Indiana Core 40 diploma. Upon completion of the program, students also graduate with a workplace certification through WorkOne and/or a college dual credit. This program includes free on-site child care.
site_details: Visit https://excelatgoodwill.org/enroll/ to enroll or call for more information.
site_eligibility: Age 18 and older -- No sex offender record

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides a variety of social services, including employment related services and educational services.
service_description: Provides a resource center for job seekers with computer access, online job boards, assistance setting up an email account, online tutorials and workshops, and access to a fax machine and copier. Services include resume building, computer instruction, mock interviews, hiring events, and connecting to individuals community resources and job leads.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides a variety of social services, including employment related services and educational services.
service_description: Provides a resource center for job seekers with computer access, online job boards, assistance setting up an email account, online tutorials and workshops, and access to a fax machine and copier. Services include resume building, computer instruction, mock interviews, hiring events, and connecting to individuals community resources and job leads.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization dedicated to eliminating racism, empowering women and promoting peace, justice, freedom, and dignity for all.
service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to  victims of domestic violence in St.  Joseph County. Assists in the filing of protective orders, offers court accompaniment services, and provides information about case status, victim rights, and the legal process.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment with a legal advocate.
site_eligibility: Persons who have experienced domestic violence, sexual assault, stalking or human trafficking.

service_description: Provides individual and group counseling to victims of rape, sexual assault, incest, and childhood sexual abuse. The program also offers referrals to shelter for recent victims of rape and school-based outreach to area teenagers on issues of date rape and teen dating violence.

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Elkhart County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Elkhart County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Whitley County. A seven-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Elkhart County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Elkhart County.
service_description: Maintains the Elkhart County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18)

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing shelter services, adoption and education programs, including a pet food assistance program.
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances in Elkhart County/responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and accepts surrendered animals from the public. Provides lost-and-found services, animal trap rental, microchipping of pets, humane euthanasia for terminally ill pets, and adoption for homeless dogs and cats. Volunteer opportunities available.
site_details: Lost and Found: Call immediately if a pet is lost or found; walk in to view impounded animals or to turn over a stray animal. -- Adoption: Walk in during adoption hours. (Visit website to view available animals.) -- Surrender: Walk in with animal to be surrendered. -- For after-hour emergencies, call Elkhart County Dispatch.
site_schedule: Adoption Hours: Mon, Tues, Thurs and Fri 11am-4:30pm; Wed 12pm-4:30pm; Sat 11am-3:30pm
site_eligibility: Animal Control/Surrender/Euthanasia: Elkhart County -- Adoptions: Open service area

site_details: Lost and Found: Call immediately if a pet is lost or found; walk in to view impounded animals or to turn over a stray animal. -- Adoption: Walk in during adoption hours. (Visit website to view available animals.) -- Surrender: Walk in with animal to be surrendered. -- For after-hour emergencies, call Elkhart County Dispatch.
site_schedule: Adoption Hours: Mon, Tues, Thurs and Fri 11am-4:30pm; Wed 12pm-4:30pm; Sat 11am-3:30pm
site_eligibility: Animal Control/Surrender/Euthanasia: Elkhart County -- Adoptions: Open service area

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing shelter services, adoption and education programs, including a pet food assistance program.
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances in Elkhart County/responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and accepts surrendered animals from the public. Provides lost-and-found services, animal trap rental, microchipping of pets, humane euthanasia for terminally ill pets, and adoption for homeless dogs and cats. Volunteer opportunities available.
site_details: Lost and Found: Call immediately if a pet is lost or found; walk in to view impounded animals or to turn over a stray animal. -- Adoption: Walk in during adoption hours. (Visit website to view available animals.) -- Surrender: Walk in with animal to be surrendered. -- For after-hour emergencies, call Elkhart County Dispatch.
site_schedule: Adoption Hours: Mon, Tues, Thurs and Fri 11am-4:30pm; Wed 12pm-4:30pm; Sat 11am-3:30pm
site_eligibility: Animal Control/Surrender/Euthanasia: Elkhart County -- Adoptions: Open service area

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing shelter services, adoption and education programs, including a pet food assistance program.
service_description: Offers a thrift store with discounted prices for new and used clothing, household items, and pet supplies. Selections vary based on donations. All proceeds benefit the animal shelter.
site_details: Walk in during thrift store hours. -- The thrift store is located in the red barn on the grounds of the Humane Society. -- To donate items walk in during office hours or call to make arrangements.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing shelter services, adoption and education programs, including a pet food assistance program.
service_description: Provides free, temporary emergency shelter on-site for pets, with an owner in crisis, without putting the family pet in jeopardy. Services are exclusive to help during emergencies such as fire, hospitalization of owner, at-risk homelessness, and domestic violence victims leaving abusive situations. Placement may be up to 10 days and is based on foster availability.
site_details: Call to speak with staff for phone assessment.
site_eligibility: Pets owners in emergencies or fleeing domestic violence -- Without a safe place to keep pet during crisis

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing shelter services, adoption and education programs, including a pet food assistance program.
service_description: Provides a limited supply of pet food for pet owners who cannot afford to purchase food for their pets. Donations of pet food and supplies to support this program are welcome.
site_details: Call for information about receiving or donating pet food.
site_eligibility: In financial economic hardship -- With pet current on rabies vaccination -- Willing to spay/neuter pet, if pet is not already altered (assistance may be available)

agency_name: OPEN GATE PRAISE AND DELIVERANCE MINISTRIES
agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry and clothes closet.
site_name: OPEN GATE PRAISE AND DELIVERANCE MINISTRIES
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to seniors in need. Open service area.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_name: BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS SOUTHERN LAKE REGION
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that matches at-risk youth with adult mentors.
site_name: BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS SOUTHERN LAKE REGION - ELKHART COUNTY OFFICE
service_description: Matches children from one parent families in need of support with professionally supported adult mentors who have shared interests. Community-Based Mentors volunteer two to four times per month for at least one year. Site-Based Mentors volunteer once a week for at least 30 minutes at a child's school or community center for at least one full school year.
site_details: To Volunteer: Call or visit website to complete application and pass background checks. -- To Request a Mentor for a Child: Call or complete online application. -- For questions about enrollment: call or email enrollment@becomeabig.com.
site_schedule: Available by phone: Mon-Thurs 8am-4pm; Fri 8am-noon -- Services are provided weekends, evening, and out-of-school times.
site_eligibility: Adult Mentors: Age 18 or older -- Youth Participants: Ages 6-17 at time of enrollment in primarily single-parent homes (may stay in program to age 18)

agency_name: BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS SOUTHERN LAKE REGION

site_eligibility: Adult Mentors: Age 18 or older -- Youth Participants: Ages 6-17 at time of enrollment in primarily single-parent homes (may stay in program to age 18)

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides a one-time assistance for baby formula during emergencies for families with infants. Recurring assistance is available for those participating in other services at this location.
site_details: Call to schedule a pick-up for baby formula during emergencies.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-8pm
site_eligibility: With an infant in the household on supplemental feeding -- In emergency or first time seeking assistance from this agency for baby formula

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides parenting and childbirth education programs for parents and expectant parents. Participants earn coupons that can be redeemed at Crib Club for baby and maternity items. Classes are available in-person as well as online zoom classes.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment or to find out about upcoming classes.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-8pm
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and parents of children age 5 or younger

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides parenting and childbirth education programs for parents and expectant parents. Participants earn coupons that can be redeemed at Crib Club for baby and maternity items. Classes are available in-person as well as online zoom classes.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment or to find out about upcoming classes.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-8pm
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and parents of children age 5 or younger

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides free, walk-in pregnancy testing, pregnancy verification required for medical benefits, and referrals to prenatal care, adoption agencies, and other abortion alternatives for women facing a crisis pregnancy. No referrals are made to abortion service providers.
site_details: Walk-ins accepted; calling ahead is recommended.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-8pm
site_eligibility: Women

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Offers ultrasounds to individuals who are pregnant, determines viability and age of pregnancy.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-8pm
site_eligibility: First trimester of pregnancy

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides diapers, baby clothing (up to size 5T), and maternity clothing for new and expectant mothers in need. Items are available to clients who attend parenting classes in order to earn coupons for use at Crib Club where they can be redeemed for baby items. Maternity clothing is available without participating in the classes.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-8pm
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and mothers or fathers of children age 5 or younger

Maternity clothing is available without participating in the classes.

site_schedule: Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 9am-8pm
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and mothers or fathers of children age 5 or younger

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit residential treatment program that empowers women to address the root causes of life-controlling issues and addictions.
service_description: Provides transitional living and case management services for women who face barriers to self-sufficiency due to addiction, domestic violence, ex-offender status, or other life situations. Participants must commit to stay up to twelve months and be open to biblical training and teaching; children are not permitted during this time, but visitation is available. After graduation, permanent supported housing is offered and children may accompany the parent in this phase of the program. This is NOT an emergency shelter.
site_details: Call for information or visit the website to complete an online application.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 9am-4pm -- SPA House: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Women -- Age 18 or older -- In need of a supportive living environment due to addiction, domestic violence, ex-offender status, or other barriers to self-sufficiency -- Not requiring medically supervised detoxification

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides programs that strengthen community safety, provide support and compensation and reconciliation to various individuals.
service_description: Provides community mediation services to those in conflict, such as landlord/tenant, client/business, employer/employee, neighborhood, or multi-party/group conflicts. Other services include family mediation dealing with family law conflicts of custody and divorce.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule a mediation session.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides programs that strengthen community safety, provide support and compensation and reconciliation to various individuals.
service_description: Offers a reentry program and information and referral to people who have been incarcerated or recovering from substance use that are looking for housing, employment, and assistance in overcoming barriers to self-sufficiency.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Recently released from incarceration past year

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Goshen in Elkhart County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Goshen in Elkhart County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Elkhart County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Goshen in Elkhart County

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A faith-based residential recovery facility that offers recovery assistance, counseling, and transitional housing for women with substance abuse issues.
service_description: Maintains a faith-based, supported-living home for women recovering from alcohol or drug addiction. Provides case management, life skills, support groups, and counseling. Nine to twelve month program requires a minimum six month commitment.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit the website to fill out an application. www.rosegardenrecovery.com
site_eligibility: Women -- Age 18 or older -- Recovering from substance abuse -- Can pass a breathalyzer and urine screen -- Willing to obtain employment -- Adhere to house rules

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Personal grooming and toiletry items may be available depending on donations. Open service area.
site_details: Enter at the north (rear) door. Food pantry is in the basement (lower level). -- First-time visitors will need to complete a registration form.
site_eligibility: Limit two visits per month

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency working to prevent child abuse and strengthen families. CAPS offers home visits, supervised visitation, preschool, advocacy and education programs.
service_description: Provides home-based case management and advocacy services to help families with children overcome life challenges. The focus of this program is to strengthen families and protect children by providing preventative programs and connections to local resources. This voluntary program provides four months of service.
site_details: Call to request services.
site_eligibility: Parents or guardians -- With children age 0-17 -- Not enrolled in the Healthy Families Program -- May not have an open DCS case -- May not have a child in the home on probation

agency_desc: A cooperative of school districts that provides centralized special education services to students living within the boundaries of the participating school districts.
service_description: Provides education support for students with disabilities and special needs. Assessment and special education services are generally accessed through the assigned public school.

site_eligibility: Living in Baugo, Concord, Fairfield, Goshen, Middlebury, or Wa-Nee school district -- Age 3-22 years-old -- With special needs, including developmental, vision, and hearing impairments

service_description: Offers instruction in basic reading, math, language arts, science, social studies, life skills, and job readiness as well as preparation for the high school equivalency test. Morning and evening classes available throughout the year. There are no fees for these classes.
site_details: Call the Adult and Community Education Office to schedule an orientation.
site_schedule: Mon-Thurs 8am-8pm; Fri 8am-4pm -- Summer: Mon-Fri 8am-3:30pm -- Classes: Vary
site_eligibility: Ages 18 and older (17 year olds are considered on case-by-case basis) -- Not currently enrolled in school

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Serves as an official testing center for Indiana's high school equivalency test, which enables people who did not complete high school to earn a high school equivalency diploma. Testing at this location takes place weekly over the course of three days for paper format and two days for computer format.
site_details: Pre-registration required. Walk in to the Community Education Office to register. Payment due at time of registration.
site_schedule: Mon-Thurs 8am-8pm; Fri 8am-4pm -- Summer: Mon-Fri 8am-3:30pm -- Testing: Varies
site_eligibility: Have lived in Indiana for at least 30 days --Age 18 or older (recommended); ages 16-17 may be eligible to take the test  with a letter of recommendation signed by a superintendent of an Indiana public school system and an exit interview from the previous school attended -- Not enrolled in high school

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; call for details.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living in Elkhart County -- Age 6 months or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_schedule: Scheduling/Information: Mon 8am-5pm; Tues-Fri 8am-4pm -- Appointments: Vary by location
site_eligibility: Living in withiin the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Elkhart County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, public swimming pools, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, and air or water pollution. Provides radon test kits for a fee, and offers information and referrals regarding household environmental hazards such as mold, lead, and water contamination. Collects and identifies vector mosquitoes relevant to human disease. Monitors storage of hazardous chemicals and verifies cleanup of significant spills and of methamphetamine labs.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Elkhart County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, public swimming pools, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, and air or water pollution. Provides radon test kits for a fee, and offers information and referrals regarding household environmental hazards such as mold, lead, and water contamination. Collects and identifies vector mosquitoes relevant to human disease. Monitors storage of hazardous chemicals and verifies cleanup of significant spills and of methamphetamine labs.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.

service_description: Provides a smoking cessation program with individualized counseling for pregnant women. Requires four prenatal meetings during pregnancy and then, monthly meetings after delivery. Clients may select a smoking support partner, who resides with them, to enroll.  Participants who remain smoke-free throughout the pregnancy and first year of the baby's birth, may each qualify for a $25 diaper voucher each month, to be redeemed at a Walmart store.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon 10am-2pm and 3pm-7pm; Tues 9:30am-12:30pm and 1pm-6pm; Wed and Thurs 8:30am-12:30pm and 1pm-5pm; Fri 8:30am-12:30pm
site_eligibility: Pregnant women, with or without a smoking support partner (living in the same household) -- Currently smoking or smoked at least 3 months prior to pregnancy -- Willing to quit smoking and submit to a breath/saliva test

service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from Elkhart General Hospital. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for full or partial financial assistance based on their income. (Note: Uninsured patients automatically receive a discount on their bill for self-payment.)

Financial Assistance Applications and policies are available in English and Spanish.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). Applications based on a lottery can be received forth Housing Choice Voucher Program are accepted on the 1st Monday of the month. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Housing Choice Voucher Wait List receives applications by lottery on the first business day of the month at 8am. -- Those already on the wait list should walk in to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: Call to verify if wait list is open. -- When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. -- Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, domestic violence victims, homeless families and veterans
